intro: Pteronia sordida, commonly known as the sticky pteronia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its woolly, hairy leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained sandy or rocky soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Pteronia sordida is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
